programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Triangles and wedges are the building blocks of modern quilts. Color enthusiast Rebecca Bryan creates graphic quilt samplers with bold-colored triangles. Quilters Kara Sanders and Elizabeth Dackson talk about organizing quilting retreats that refuel creative energy. Designer Christina Cameli uses 10-degree triangles to create a versatile blocks for a variety of modern designs.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: All quilters can get stuck in a creative rut, even Angela. This week, she turns to strip piecing and her fun, easy-to-piece chevron pattern to get her quilting mojo back. Plus, she'll show you how to use negative space to bring your quilt to life.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Are you Quilt Curious, but unsure where to get started? THIS is the Midnight Quilt Show episode for you!

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: There are certain garments and styles that stand the test of time and can be worn by every age. Emily Thompson begins with the perfect front button skirt in a mommy and me style. This two-part lesson with continue next time with buttons and button holes. Then, it's the perfect jacket with Angela Wolf and how to add facing to an unlined classic jacket design.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Stacking bracelets are today's hottest style statement. Jewelry designer Meredith Roddy creates three distinct styles of stacking bracelets to combine or to wear alone. Candie Cooper designs trendy earrings for teens and tweens in Katie's Beading Lesson.

programme.title: Beads, Baubles & Jewels
programme.desc: Link filigree and pendants in creative ways. Learn to flat crimp a multi strand bracelet with Candie Cooper, make a square link to link bracelet with Patti Bullard and a draped necklace using premade chain -- whether crimping, wrapping; link your jewelry together with these creative ideas.

programme.title: Scrapbook Soup
programme.desc: Scrapbook Soup is the show for scrapbookers, paper crafters, card makers and anyone interested in preserving memories through photos.

programme.title: Knitting
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: Knit-Along: Socks
programme.desc: Learn to knit with CraftsyTV.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: All quilters can get stuck in a creative rut, even Angela. This week, she turns to strip piecing and her fun, easy-to-piece chevron pattern to get her quilting mojo back. Plus, she'll show you how to use negative space to bring your quilt to life.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: The holidays are coming, but don't stress! We teamed up with Angela Walters, host of the Midnight Quilt Show, to create three DIY quilt projects that are super gift-able. In this episode, you'll learn how to make a cathedral window pillow, an adorable gift for someone in your life who you've deemed "quilt-worthy." - P.S. Don't miss Angela's tips for non-quilters on what to do (and what NOT to do!) when you receive a gift from a quilter...

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela's been practicing her magic tricks! Tonight, she amazes with a magnificent optical illusion quilt. Watch as she uses solid pre-cuts to magically create her star blocks.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela shows you how to easily make a stash-buster pieced quilt back that can either match or contrast with your quilt top.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Have you ever worked on a quilt that seemed intimidating, but wasn't that bad once you got into it? Watch as Angela checks this snazzy Snail's Trail quilt from her quilting bucket list.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela shares her favorite way to make a quilt sandwich.

programme.title: Craft Hacks
programme.desc: Time-saving quick tips to feed your crafting craving.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Sewing experts offer easy ways to create neat sewing projects right at home. Viewers of all skill levels learn tips and techniques for creating professional-looking garments, personalized apparel and home accents. Weekly episodes feature various themes, and feature two main projects and one shorter technique segment. Some projects include monogramming napkins and towels; baby poncho, hooded towel and baby-friendly diapers; embellishing yoga pants with a clothing tattoo; and sewing on knits.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Take it slow with this model railroad tour.

programme.title: Slow TV
programme.desc: Slow it down with cookie decorating.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: No piping? No problem. Check out JJR's cake hacks to make a faux piped royal icing cake accented with a sugar poppy.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Watch JJR make ombré fondant ruffles and stud this cake with incredible custom "gems."

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Joshua John Russell creates modern, edible masterpieces with cake, fondant and buttercream.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Geometric cutout cakes are all the rage. JJR takes on tiled fondant and custom toppers for a modern kids' birthday cake design (sprinkles included).

programme.title: Garden Party
programme.desc: Ready to dig in and grow your green thumb? Join us for a delightful hour of expert-led gardening tutorials designed to inspire and educate gardeners of all levels. From essential planting tips and soil secrets to creative container gardening and vibrant floral arrangements, our seasoned instructors will guide you through every step. Whether you're a seasoned horticulturist or just starting out, you'll find fresh ideas and practical techniques to cultivate the garden of your dreams.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Let's make wings and fly. With paper, scissors and a little spaghetti, Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes paper feathers. Then, she crafts fuzzy bug wings from felt. Artist Franz Spohn illustrates distance and perspective in his drawings of birds in flight. Jenny crafts a bird house for our feathered friends.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Our creativity takes to the air. Jenny Barnett-Rohrs and Katie Hacker make sparkly wings and Katie creates a funny spoon bird. Franz Spohn creates see-through bug wings and we'll make a very special chalkboard gift for Mom or Dad.

programme.title: Angela's Scrappy Stars Quilt
programme.desc: Hold on to your sewing chairs! The Midnight Quilt Show is going bold, as in late-night foundation paper-piecing bold. (Angela makes it easy!)

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: This is not a drill! Angela has heard your requests loud and clear, and she's finally making the Bargello quilt that everyone's been asking for! So break out the layer cakes and prepare to get crazy with precuts.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela shows you how to make half-square triangles two at a time for a dazzling quilt that's beaming with color.

programme.title: The Midnight Quilt Show
programme.desc: Angela’s not the only Midnight Quilter in the Walters' house! Watch as she and her teenage daughter Cloe spend some quality time together making an easy-to-piece charm quilt.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.desc: Take a walk on the wild side with some unique projects on this episode. First, Emily Thompson creates a quilted tablet cover - a perfect beginner project. Then, Cheryl Sleboda, our cosplay expert, has a novel idea for cosplay or plain fun: winged feet, you'll love these fun additions to your shoes. Last, Angela Wolf shares an optional addition to the wrap dress and a built-in tank top.

programme.title: It's Sew Easy
programme.sub-title: Quilt Techniques for all Types of Sewing
programme.desc: We apply quilting concepts to all sorts of different finished projects from pillows to skirts on this show. If you're a fashion sewer, quilting is a little break from fitting and if you're a quilter we have garments that incorporate your techniques in garments. First, Paula Reid shares her creative method for doing trapunto. Then, Jeni Baker has an easy but modern feeling quilt project -- this time it's the log cabin as coasters. Finally, Angela Wolf takes a quilt technique for seaming and uses it on a patchwork style skirt.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.desc: Hold onto your needles! Tracie and Jodi, are here to dish out fresh fiber inspiration. From project picks to wooly good gossip, things are about to get super knitty… and maybe just a little nutty.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.sub-title: 11 Reasons You Should Knit Every Day
programme.desc: As if you needed more reasons to knit... The Grocery Girls are back with the 11 reasons you should be knitting every day, and some of them might surprise you!

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.sub-title: The Wonderful World of BRIOCHE Knitting
programme.desc: Baffled by brioche? Don't be! Tune in to see Lesley Anne Robinson and the Grocery Girls tackle this super squishy, double-sided fabric.

programme.title: Off Our Needles
programme.sub-title: Cutest Projects Ever: Small Knitting, Big Impact
programme.desc: The ladies are going big by thinking small! From compact cables to cute mini skeins, this one's all about the tiny treasures that keep those needles clicking.

programme.title: Hands On Crafts for Kids
programme.desc: Let's turn toward ourselves for creative ideas. When she makes a lighted mirror, Jenny Barnett-Rohrs makes you a star. Katie Hacker makes personal paper dolls and Franz Spohn draws a 3D self-portrait. Jenny celebrates Thanksgiving with Pilgrim-style table decorations.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Your suggestions and votes from the MAC flavor contest inspired this piña colada cake! JJR channels the taste of the tropics with coconut and pineapple atop textured buttercream tiers.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: Joshua John Russell creates modern, edible masterpieces with cake, fondant and buttercream.

programme.title: Man About Cake
programme.desc: No time to cure your sugar lace? Premade edible lace is the way to go (JJR treats his with airbrushing and a shabby chic design).

programme.sub-title: Making a Long-Bow in Your Shop
programme.desc: Master bowyer Tom Turgeon joins George Vondriska in the workshop to show you how to make your own long-bow. They'll discuss the kits available on the market and demystify the terminology used when talking about bow making. Learn about the art and intricac

programme.title: Fresh Quilting
programme.desc: Use shapes in new ways. Modern Quilt Guild marketing director Heather Grant discusses the modern quilt aesthetic and modern quilt designs. Blogger Rossie Hutchinson joins quilter Elizabeth Dackson to talk about improv quilt events. Instructor Rebecca Kemp Brent uses the latest cutting and quilting technology to create a confetti star quilt design.
